comment: So many Problems while working fine in VS Code. The current plugin version fails to use replace_string_in_file and insert_edit_into_file inconsistently rendering the result unstable to unusable. It seems to me GitHub is trying to drive away users from Jetbrains to VS Code on purpose.

The models it provides are one step behind VSCode as well. The Gemini 3 is still unavailable in AS right now although it could be selected.

comment:
It's a great tool. The only things that could be better is the IDE integration and I be able to select which account I want to use.

I pay for my own Copilot on my personal Git account and also have the license of Copilot paid by my company. It is a hasle to have to logout from one account and login on the other every time.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: This feels like it's intentionally left a buggy mess to promote competing editors. Every other update breaks.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Overall it can be a very useful plugin and it has to much potential, obviously. However it's very buggy! It often completely drops the new query I just wrote, opens the same old file that I used only once long time ago and shows me the previous AI conversation. If you wrote a long prompt and didn't save it, you're out of luck.

Another thing is that weirdly hardcoded file. I worked on one Helm file months ago and until today the plugin just opens it any time I pull up the Copilot plugin and start a new session.

Finally it never cleans up the tons of scripts and .md files it creates nor does it give an easy one-click solution to delete the files it created. I find myself having to chase these files in different folders of the project and deleting them manually.

The code line counting very often doesn't work, it gets the lines wrong and tells me "as you can see in line 400" where line 400 will be a completely unrelated piece of code.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: At the moment, only github-copilot-intellij-1.5.58-243 works with the latest DataGrip. You can download the plugin file from here. They likely don't plan to fix this, since they want users to switch to their own AI assistant.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
You know, Qoder is my brother. We’ve fought side by side and defeated countless opponents. I’ve been using agent mode since the early days—this guy is unbelievably powerful.

I truly believe that when the two of us team up, we’ll create something special—real chemistry.

Sometimes, making a decision is hard. After many sleepless nights of thinking it through, I’ve made up my mind: I’m going to take my talents to Qoder.

I can’t wait to activate Qoder’s premium plan.

As for GitHub Copilot— I wish it all the best in JetBrains.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Long list of issues:

  • giant security/ permission bug, plugin will run commands on the active window regardless of the project it was started in, which also means that you cannot have multiple chat sessions or multiple windows open when using the plugin.
  • Starting a new session takes over a minute to reset the chat session
  • Fails to run any agent mode/ chat (20% of the time) and clears everything you typed and resets the IDE tab to blank
  • Accept changes button does wrong Z index on macOS, causing it to be shown over all active windows, and other times loses track of where the IDE window will be on its own screen.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I've used the GitHub CoPilot Pro+ plan through VS Code using Claude Sonnet 4.5 or Opus - The results are pretty amazing to be honest

I've now used GitHub CoPilot with Jetbrain's Plugin on a similar plan but at a enterprise level - And it's like babysitting a child who's coding for the first time

After some digging around it turns out... the performance you get is very specific to the IDE you're using. They all integrate with the LLMs differently so you'll get very different results.

GitHub Copilot is heavily optimized for VS Code. It's takes all files into consideration, has context, full conversation history, etc... and has amazing results.

This Jetbrains extension is still in it's infancy. It could be as great as VS Code, but it's definitely not there yet.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: As they have a competing product, you kind of wonder if this is broke for a reason. I love the IDE but hate that this continues to occur.

comment:
Since October I can't login on my Lenovo IDEAPAD Slim 5x with Snapdragon ARM, I tried the plugin with Jetbrains IDEA IntelliJ Community and Webstorm, I tried to log out and login from Jetbrains products, I tried to Uninstall/Reinstall, Come back to previous versions of September and October of IntelliJ and the plugin, Follow this article but nothing works for me :( https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/28905779477394--Bug-Copilot-stuck-at-Retrieving-GitHub-Device-Code-in-IntelliJ-regression-in-1-5-53-243 Maybe helpful remarks :

  • When click on Sign in for Github Copilot : Dialog with Github Copilot Failed to initiate the GitHub login process. Please try again.

comment: When can I use gemini3 on JetBrains

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Full of artificial limitations and bugs not present in the VS Code version. Feels like a plugin for 2nd-class customers.

  • Delayed support for new models (supposedly improving, but still frustrating)
  • Agent tool call limitations not present in VS Code (settings artificially capped at 100), pressing Continue consumes another Premium Request (vs. no cost in VS Code)
  • Persistent bugs where Copilot Agent is unable to read terminal output or thinks it's empty, thinks files are empty and overwrites them, sees outdated versions of files, etc.
  • Recent bug where Chat just resets mid-conversation, consumes a premium request and starts working, but suddenly, poof!, back to scratch, no chat history, half-finished changes
  • Instruction following and context compression is far worse than VS Code or CLI, runs out of context much faster given same instructions, ignores simple commands like not to generate documents (same setup works fine on other versions)
  • Not open source so we can't even tell and properly debug what's going wrong with it

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It’s hard to believe that a plugin built by a billion-dollar company has such poor quality in both usability and the overall UX/UI experience, especially compared to what they offer in VS Code. The only explanation I can think of is a conflict of interest since the same company owns a competing IDE. There has to be a better way to improve both the user experience and the agentic capabilities. Windsurf has done a great job bringing the same set of features from VS Code into IntelliJ, so it’s definitely possible.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The latest model support arrives far too late.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I have to say, that I am surprised at the amount of negative reviews still posted here! Although I believe them, I can say that this plugin has improved drastically since I started using it, and I am not faced with as much as issues as I had before, and I am pleased to report a smoother experience. Keep it up devs!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
This extension is so vital and yet absolutely terrible:

  • the new LLMs take weeks to be added
  • files get modified/corrupted in agentic mode without me ever approving the changes
  • the agent asks to run the tests through bash console (and not using existing run configurations, that is integration with native IDE tools is absent) before I even confirmed the changes it suggests (doesn't make sense to test something before it exists)
  • occasionally the plugin stops responding and consumes a lot of CPU (at least in the past, nowadays it's a bit more stable)
